parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
Blind, physically or mentally. From, tuphoo; opaque, i.e. blind.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pass by, depart, pass away. From para and ago; to lead near, i.e. to go along or away.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
